reviews.review: So entertaining, the visual is so awsome, the song is legitimately good. the best part is when olaf explaining frozen 1 and 80's kristoff's music video. For me who's not keen enough with frozen part 1, this part is blown me away. love much
Loved the story , but found the songs in the first ones little bit better than the second .
Stunning visuals, a lore-rich storyline, and powerful vocal performances from Idina Menzel and Kristen Bell drive a powerful story home without losing the fun of the original.

The sequel to Disney's smash hit Frozen is finally here and while it boasts some beautiful animation and a couple of good songs, it doesn't recapture the magic of its predecessor. Frozen 2 suffers from a disjointed plot and struggles to follow a single narrative. The movie jumps from one storyline to another which unnecessarily complicates things and some songs seem to cue at awkward times. As someone who loved the first one, I had high expectations and although they weren't met to the fullest, the movie contained more on Elsa and Anna's parents, the origin of Elsa's powers and the sisters' relationship development which is what I was most looking forward to seeing. Despite lacking the lightheartedness of 2013's Frozen, it remains an awesome adventure worth watching if just to get to see the characters again.
Not that great as the original.
Loved it !!! Catchy songs, humor , dark and tearful. Definitely see it again!!!
The problem with sequels, in most cases, is that they either overdo what worked the last time or change it so drastically that it looks nothing like the first magic. Frozen suffers through both.

I took my 3 grand daughters and they loved it.
I did as well.
Not narratively tight as the original but with plenty of heart and great musical numbers and graphics it is equally as enjoyable if not even more so at times!
EPIC, A MUST WATCH, BEAUTIFUL DRESSES, BEAUTIFUL SONGS, don't trust the trailer, the trailer doesn't do any justice to the movie, the movie is super awesome, good job Disney.
